resources.string: Espresso poured on a vanilla ice cream. Served in a cappuccino cup.

Espresso with added hot water (100-150 ml). Often served in a cappuccino cup. (The espresso is added into the hot water rather than all the water being flowed through the coffee that would lead to over extraction.)
A tall, mild \'milk coffee\' (about 150-300 ml). An espresso with steamed milk and only a little milk foam poured over it. Serve in a latte glass or a coffee cup. Flavored syrup can be added.
Equal parts espresso, steamed milk, and milk foam (about 150-180 ml). The milk foam should be thick and creamy. Served in a cappuccino cup and often dusted with cocoa powder.
Espresso \'marked\' with a small amount of steamed milk or milk foam. A strong coffee drink that highlights the espresso flavor. Served in a small espresso cup.
Espresso with chocolate syrup or powder, steamed milk, and whipped cream. A sweet coffee drink perfect for chocolate lovers. Often topped with cocoa powder or chocolate shavings.
A concentrated coffee brewed by forcing hot water through finely-ground coffee beans. Served in a small cup (30-50 ml) and forms the base for most coffee drinks.
